body:
Thank you for your reply.

1) Well, this can happen with anything you do ;-)

2) Is there anything else so obvious rendudant in go? I didn't encounter it yet. Or probably I didn't get your point.

3) It's currently not consistent in that methods without return values don't require a return statement at the end. Imo it would be consistent if *no* return statement would be needed. Return is a control statement, but at the very end of the function it doesn't serve this purpose in any way.

BTW, this change would be 100% backwards-compatible.
